body: Change the implementation from annotation to line marker provider. This allows the gutter previews to be hidden when the system preference to do so is turned off. This implementation is less rigid w.r.t formatting and comments, eg, this is recognized: `Color . fromRGBO ( 0, 255 /* still green */, 0, 0.5 ) )` It also adds a color picker when a color preview is clicked. Named colors, like `Color.blue`, also show the preview but cannot be changed with the color picker. The color picker will display, but the color will not be changed. Replacing non-leaf nodes in the PSI tree causes an error in the editor framework. We might be able to replace the text in the Document but we'd have to solve the problem of translating hex color values to named Material or Cupertino colors first. The Dart plugin is updated to latest, which allows most unit tests to be run from IntelliJ. While debugging the problem with tests I realized a couple of testing helper classes should be declared abstract to make their role more clear. Fixes #4986 Fixes #3919 Fixes #3448

comment_data.body: I'm not sure what this comment and the next one express - is this condition more complex than when the color is presented in the form `Colors.blue`?

These are "notes to self" (or next maintainer) about the structure of the PSI tree. JetBrains' Dart parser produces an AST in a style I remember reading about in my compilers class, but never actually used in any compiler I worked on. I work in the PSI tree every couple years, it seems, and it takes me some time to get back up to speed. These notes should help for next time.

In this case `name` is "Colors" and the first child of the reference expression is also "Colors" so we know we're looking at `Colors.blue` or some other named color. The next case is the structure for a shade reference, like `Colors.blue.shade200`.

commit.message: Add tests and remove old files; update Dart

title: Update color and icon previews
